intro: Pleurostachys martiana, commonly known as the mountain orchid, is a species native to the high-altitude regions of Central America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas, thriving in cool and moist environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are usually pale green or white with a subtle fragrance. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
